WRITING.TITLE: Girl here, I need help finding a nice present for my boyfriend
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
He's into technology and cars. He drinks beer and loves watching movies

WRITING.TITLE: Is it OK to ask for gift ideas for boyfriend here?
WRITING.TEXT: If it is, I would love some help. My boyfriend is turning 21 very soon and I have no idea what to get for him... He's doesn't want perfumes, clothes .. I need a nice original idea up to $100. Maybe something I can make, but I've been very uninspired lately with creativity and haven't thought of anything. Any suggestions?
This happened to me on the first two weeks and went away. Good luck
What's your weight? I'm 60kg, on 40mg stopped breaking out by a month and a half
Do you wear makeup? I had a similar problem and found switching my makeup remover helped immensely. Switched from Garnier essentials 2 in 1 makeup remover to L'oreal hydrophilic oil

WRITING.TITLE: I need some help finding a new foundation.
WRITING.TEXT:
My skin used to be very oily and I had some acne. Now,I just started my fourth month of accutane. My skin is just normal right now, but I get flakiness sometimes especially around my nose.
I'm looking for a foundation with medium coverage, matte but not cakey, that won't accentuate dryness.
Now my other problem is that I have fair warm toned skin, which makes it hard to find the right color. I'm NC15 in MAC, Bobbi brown warm ivory. Thanks in advance!!!!
Get out of there, if he doesn't love you for who you are you shouldn't be with him
Yeah second this! Huge success but what are you using?
Awesome! Hope you enjoy it
Patisserie

I had been almost 7 years when my bf and had a bad feeling about a slutty girl from his work. He reassured me everything is fine. And sure enough, a few months later he cheated on me with her, we broke up. They moved in together after a few days.
So I say, go with your gut feeling. Its probably not an innocent friendship

WRITING.TITLE: Am I allowed to use vitamic C while on accutane?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm on my third month of accutane and haven't had a new pimple in a month now. However, I do have some marks old pimples left. I'm interested in using vitamin C to treat them. Is it OK while on accutane? Just thought I'd mention I am using sunscreen every single day
The lady at Kiehl's told me that their sunscreen is so powerful, I would only need to use a tiny amount, just enough to cover my face. I turned around and left.

Good quality, soft "buttery" shadows (I hate this word, but they're on the creamy side of shadows, I'm sure you know what I mean) Some fallout with the more shimmery shades Pigmentation is wonderful. Definitely worth the price! I've been so happy with it, and can't wait to get my hands on the 2nd one
I think you look very beautiful in both pics! IMO you can rock that lip with just mascara on the eyes, don't feel the need to.go dramatic.
Love benefit watts up. Especially on fair skin. It's very hard for me to find a highlight that isn't too golden or too silvery. This one is perfect
Hope you found the solution!! Good luck
I have a similar story to you. 22yo 60 kg doing 40 mg for 8 months

I have to say that taking accutane is very individual. My only issue is dry lips, sometimes dry nose and eyelids but not all the time.
I started seeing an improvement by the second week, and by 1.5 I stopped breaking out

40mg, 3 months in. Will stay on this dosage for the rest of the course, doing 8 months. I definitely prefer a low dosage and longer course to keep the side effects at bay. Of course heavier people naturally will need to do higher dosages, so keep that in mind. I weigh 60kg

Looove the non oily skin and hair!!! From washing hair every day to twice a week. And makeup stays on for more than 12 hours without moving or fading even the slightest bit. BTW, remember to moisturize well even if you had oily skin

Girl I know the feeling!!! I'm on month three out of 8. Still a long way to go (although 100% worth it!!!!) And yes to guerlain lipstick. Packaging is some of the most beautiful in my opinion, and you deserve it after so long!
I have very dark brown eyes and extremely enjoy using coppers , as they bring out the more brown tones in my eyes. Also purple, olive green, military green

I'm the type of person who would rather get up an hour earlier than I technically need so I won't be in a rush, and have a peaceful morning. If I start my day this way, I feel better, refreshed, I'm in a good mood and usually even have more energy.
Doing my makeup could take 10 minutes for a simple look, but I do work in a makeup counter which means I obviously want to look my best every single day, and makeup plays a huge part, naturally. So if I have the time, I do my makeup slowly and carefully, and I really enjoy this process. It's my relaxing time, and its also like a toy for me. On a day like this I can even take up to an hour. Oh, the perfectionism.
About the husbands who don't understand, he should be aware of how makeupakes you feel and affects your day. I know some people who wake up early to read the entire newspaper, smoke and drink coffee. Then you have the people who work out in the morning. For us makeup addicts, it's the same thing.
That's so mean and as somebody who works in a makeup counter I'd say what you did is "the perfect client". Knows what she wants, even brought a picture and is decided. I love this kind of client
Mac patisserie. Doesn't get enough love in the internet world imo

I carry a concealer in a pencil form like the L'oreal one, or even the click up one with the brush on the top like Maybelline and its really saves me every time. So easy to stick in your purse! I just touch up where I lost the coverage. No need to buy an expensive concealer for this BTW
2nd on this!!! Its really good quality, staying power and pigmentation. Dupes for almost all shades in naked 1 2. Emily Noel from beauty broadcast has a dupe comparison, check it out!
True! For a moment forgot about the ABCDE... Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: Something happened to this mole, used to be just light brown and suddenly got these 2 dark dots. Is it dangerous?
